summary: Website with multiple timer modes (Pomodoro, stopwatch, interval, countdown, repeating) and customizable backgrounds (images/videos) with a default bluish-black theme and no file-type limitations, plus an optional YouTube-embed background mode.
architectural_notes: Current background URL support expects direct media file links (e.g., .mp4/.webm/.jpg); add an alternate path for YouTube watch URLs using an embedded player/iframe and handle autoplay/mute restrictions.

existing_features.title: Create a single-page timer app UI that lets the user switch between these timer modes: Pomodoro, Stopwatch, Interval Timer, Countdown Timer, and Repeating Timer.
Implement Pomodoro mode with configurable durations (work length, short break length, long break length, and long-break frequency) and controls to start/pause, skip, and reset the current segment.
Implement Stopwatch mode with start/pause, reset, and lap recording.
Implement Countdown mode where the user sets a target duration and can start/pause and reset the countdown.
Implement Interval Timer mode where the user defines a set of repeating intervals (e.g., work/rest) and number of rounds, with controls to start/pause, skip interval, and reset.
Implement Repeating Timer mode where the user sets a duration and an optional repeat count (or infinite repeat) and the timer automatically restarts each time it reaches zero.
Add background customization that allows the user to set the site background using either uploaded local files or a direct URL, supporting both images and videos.

Do not impose artificial file-type restrictions on background uploads (e.g., do not restrict to JPEG); accept any browser-supported image or video formats and provide a clear error only when the browser cannot preview/play the selected media.
Create a default visual theme for the app (before any user background is chosen) using a “bluish black” look, ensuring readability of timer controls on top of the background.
Add a new YouTube background option in the Background Settings UI that lets the user paste a YouTube URL (watch URL, youtu.be short URL, or embed URL) and set it as the app background.
Extend the background state model to support a third media type for YouTube embeds, and persist it in the existing localStorage key so the YouTube background survives page refreshes.
Render YouTube backgrounds in the background stage using an embedded player (iframe) that behaves like a background: fills the viewport, stays behind the app UI, and does not show player controls.
Implement robust YouTube URL parsing and validation that extracts the video id from common URL formats and rejects unsupported cases with clear errors.

new_feature_requests.summary: Implement multiple timer types: Pomodoro, stopwatch, interval, countdown, and repeating timers
Allow users to customize website background using uploaded/selected images and videos (no restrictive file-type limitations)
Create a default site theme with a nice bluish-black color prior to user customization
Keep the app free to use with no feature limitations tied to file formats (e.g., not restricted to JPEG)
Support using YouTube videos as backgrounds via an embed/player option (in addition to direct image/video files/URLs)

projectName: Multi-timer website with customizable image/video backgrounds and bluish-black default theme
